comment.author: 59898224@N07
comment._content: Chief Mkwawa was chief of the Hehe tribe  in late 1880s. He was well known to the Germans who he defeated in battle in 1891 at Rugaro River. The German army were fighting  to colonise large parts of what is now Tanzania. Between 1894 and 1898 the Germans fought with Chief Mkwawa's forces until finally over whelmed Chief Mkwawa committed suicide. The German's took his head off and took it to Germany  and displayed it in a museum.It was returned  in 1954 to the Mkwawa Memorial museum in  Kalenga,Iringa Tanzania.The return of the skull to the WaHehe was stipulated in the treaty of Versailles 1919

comment.author: 67127882@N07
comment._content: The picture is of Chief Adam Sapi, with Mkwawa's skull in its special display case, in the museum at Kalenga, Iringa District.
